p: After incubation, plates were revealed with 1% (m/v) bacteriological broth containing 7 mg/mL triphenyltetrazolic chloride solution and incubated for further 30 min at 30 ± 5 °C for bacteria, and at 25 ± 5 °C for C. albicans. The maintenance of the red colour in the medium was interpreted as microbial growth.
